lines.text: Love and a 45."
[after injecting Billy with a drug]
One-one-thousand, two-one-thousand, three... are you ready to rock, Billy?
I'm born on a green light, daddy-o!
Oh, Christ, Billy. What have you done?
Oh shit! I think I shot her!
Do you hear that sound? It's the fuckin' cops... and you just blew your girlfriend's brains all over the place.
She saw my face, man!
Shut up!

[Narrating]
I regretted having to fork Billy in the neck, but, I swear to God, he'd have shot me if I hadn't. I'd often liked Billy, but he was crazy... And I hoped that he was killed.
Watty, are you shittin' me? You're gonna' take me to Mexico?
You know you don't have to come with me, Star.
Baby, I'd follow you to Oklahoma!
Never believe a word anyone says... and never rob a store with a loaded gun. Never!
Yes, sir.
That way no one gets hurt.

[Narrating]
You see, if you want something in life, you gotta' be able to go out there and take it. Nobody's gonna' hand it to you on a plate.

[Narrating]
Her name is Starlene Cheatham. I'm Watty Watts. We specialize in 'Risk Management.'
Well, if it ain't my favorite two homicidal maniacs... Creepy Cody and Dinosaur Bob. How're you boys doin'?
You know, I hate breakfast. It makes me want to puke.
Hey, Watt, who was that?
Two asshole Bible salesmen.
What'd they want?
To save my soul.
I've got a problematical situation going on. I borrowed two thousand dollars from Father Pecro to buy that wedding ring.
See, you're a stupid asshole.
Well, I couldn't help it, man, it was on sale.

[Offering Watty some sort of drug]
Hey, man, you sure you don't want any of this?
I don't think it's such a good idea for you to be doin' that shit before a job.
Cleans out my brain.
Turns your brain into chewing gum.

he'd packed a loaded gun. Speed-snortin' psychopath sittin' next to me, had interrupted the flow of my happiness. He had killed someone in my presence... and in all likelihood, my life had been fucked.
You're crazier than a road lizard, Billy.
Simp just had four cups of that *Eye*-talian coffee. He's a little twitchy.
Yeah, me and Simp were just cruising the neighborhood, and knowing your feeling towards robbing and stealing, well, we just stopped on in to have us a little chat.
Well, I've been livin' the straight and narrow so why don't you take your chicken-fried, crypto-fascist ass, out of my fuckin' house before I call the cops.
We ARE the cops, shit brain.

[Holding his pistol point-blank at Watty's head]
You know what it feels like to hold a gun up to a punk's head?

[Unfazed]
I don't really like guns.
It feels real good!

[to Watty]
You see, I'm on the right side of the law. That means I can get away with murder. "Course, you bein' on the wrong side... that puts you in rather a bad pinch, don't it? I can smell that job all over you, Watts. Like a six-day-old pair of underwear.
I didn't do shit, man.

[narrating]
Billy had been right. Once you smell someone fryin'... you can't ever think clearly again.
Looks like it's gonna' be a shotgun weddin', hon.

[Rating his skill as a tattoo artist]
Put a needle in my hand, I'm a regular "Victor" Van Gogh.

[Narrating]
Vergil ripped his own throat open during a heavy acid trip in the early sixties. Vergil was born poor... and when he read that the government was paying students to participate in experiments with psychedelic drugs... he volunteered. They dosed him with something called BZ... Vergil lost it. He won a huge settlement in court... which allowed him to live well without workin'. Later in his life, Vergil lost the function in his legs due to an amphetamine addiction he acquired while tryin' to lose weight so he could avoid the draft. He threw a clot and lost the use of his legs. But Star's parents have never been addicts... they're just handicapped, suburban hippies.
The only way out is in.
Praise the Lord!
And the only way to get there is to free yourself... to face the seething, bloodthirsty darkness in your own heart... Have you ever faced yourself in a mirror and gesticulated like a madman, Watty?

[Somewhat bemused]
Well, Vergil, I can't say I have, as of yet.
Until you do, you are nothing. And until you embrace the eternal nothingness of your existence, you will NOT BE FREE! Do you follow my lead?

[Still bemused]
Well, yeah, Vergil, I think that I do... uh, I'm nothin'... 'til I'm nothin'.

[Beaming proudly]
Right on!
Hey, what the fuck is up with y'all? You think you can come in my place and start fuckin' with the customers, huh?
[Bob fires a shot into the floor between the Artist's feet]
That is *exactly* what I think.
You have a problem with that?
...No. No, you guys are cool.
Sit down and don't speak 'til you're spoken to!
Billy, I have something to confess... I lied about being a tattoo artist. Fact is, I really don't know what the hell I'm doing with this thing!
No fuckin' shit.
But I would be *glad* to continue, that is, unless you want to give me the *right* answers to my questions.
